titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Gossip Society manuscript volume, 1803-1804 MS 218
titlestmt.author: Susan Meadows

publicationstmt.publisher: Woodson Research Center, Rice University, Houston, Texas

note.p: Stored off-site at the Library Service Center. Please request this material via woodson@rice.edu or call 713-348-2586.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-04-01 19:16:28 -0500.

did.head: Collection Summary

repository.corpname: Woodson Research Center, Rice University, Houston, Texas

did.abstract: The volume contains the productions of the Sisterhood of the Gossip Society of Gloucester, England. The author is unknown, but goes by the nom de plume "Penelope Placid." The entire work is purportedly a product of these women's meetings; more likely, it is the work of one woman satirizing the situation of elderly spinsters whom society considered to be gossips in nineteenth century England.

bioghist.head: Historical Sketch
bioghist.p: Gloucester, England is a town of approximately 123,000 people in the southwestern part of England. The town lies in the county of Gloucestershire, close to the Welsh border.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The volume contains the productions of the Sisterhood of the Gossip Society of Gloucester, England. The author is unknown, but goes by the nom de plume "Penelope Placid." The entire work is purportedly a product of these women's meetings; more likely, it is the work of one woman satirizing the situation of elderly spinsters whom society considered to be gossips in nineteenth century England.
Among the daily entries are moral lessons, small observations, anecdotes, and tales all told by members of the society.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: This material is open for research.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Stored off-site at the Library Service Center. Please request this material via woodson@rice.edu or call 713-348-2586.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: This volume was purchased in 1953 through the Friends' Fund (gift of Mr. and Mrs. Perry Olcott). See Scherling Catalogue no. 49 (1953) item no. 80 MOF W 25396.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Gossip Society manuscript volume, 1803-1804, MS 218, Woodson Research Center, Fondren Library, Rice University.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Permission to publish material from the Gossip Society manuscript volume must be obtained from the Woodson Research Center.
